column1: Parral is a city and commune in the Linares Province of Chile's Maule Region.
Parral is located 40 km (25 mi) south of Linares and 97 kilometers south of Talca
column2: on the southern border of the Maule Region and Linares Province. Parral borders on the north with the communes of Longaví
column3: Retiro and Colbún (with which it shares a short border in the cordillerana zone); on the west with the coomune of Cauquenes (Cauquenes Province); on the south with the commune of Ñiquén and San Fabián and Ñuble Province (Bío-Bío Region); and on the east
column4: with the commune of San Fabián.

column2: 638.4 km2 (632.6 sq mi) in area. The river Perquilauquén forms its southern border.

column1: Parral was founded in 1795 by the Viceroy of Peru
column2: Ambrosio O'Higgins.  It was originally named Villa Reina Luisa del Parral in honor of the wife of Carlos IV
column3: the King of Spain.Parral is the birthplace of poet Pablo Neruda
column4: winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1971.

column1: The city of Parral is the second most populous city in Linares Province with a population of more than 26
column5: 425 (30.0%) in surrounding rural areas. The ratio of men to women is 101 to 100. Between the census of 1992 and that of 2002
column6: the population of the municipality fell by 0.6% (245 people)
column7: exclusively in the rural population; the city of Parral grew by around 1
column8: 900 people (7.7%). Parral has welcomed immigration from Italy and Germany.

column2: Parral is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is Israel Urrutia Escobar (PDC).Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column4: Parral is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by Guillermo Ceroni (PPD) and Ignacio Urrutia (UDI) as part of the 40th electoral district
column8: Pelluhue and Chanco). The commune is represented in the Senate by Hernán Larraín (UDI) and Ximena Rincón González (PDC) as part of the 11th senatorial constituency (Maule-South).
